mechanoreception.notes: Presence of thorny spines on arms suggests mechanoreception capabilities for detecting water currents and nearby objects. The flexible arms further support this.

chemoreception.notes: Tube feet inside the mouth edge suggest chemoreceptive abilities for detecting food sources. The absence of mouth papillae, but presence of tooth papillae, could also contribute to chemoreception.

vision.notes: No information on photoreceptors is provided.
